results.title: Tender loving care
results.creator_credit: David Wheeler, Rob Landeros and Aftermath Media
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Andrew Neiderman and directed by David Wheeler, “Tender loving care” is an interactive movie where the viewer’s involvement can alter the outcome. The story revolves around the Overton couple who are suffering the trauma of a personal tragedy. When a psychiatric nurse comes to their aid, all sorts of mysteries and secrets begin to unfold. In between scenes the view is given thematic apperception tests about the characters and also personal views and interpretations. Clues are also discovered by navigating through the 3D environments or certain parts in the film. Guided by Doctor Turner (John Hurt), your journey through “Tender Loving Care” is a psychological experience that changes each time you play. Cast includes Michael Esposito, Beth Tegarden and Marie Caldare.

results.title: Erin Brockovich [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Steven Soderbergh, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg, Stacey Sher, Columbia Picture and Jersey Films
results.brief_description: Erin Brockovich (Julia Roberts) is a single mother raising three young children. Failing to win a law suit following an automobile accident, she begins work as a secretary for lawyer Ed Masry where she stumbles over a small case against Pacific Gas and Electric. Further investigation reveals the company is responsible for contaminating the town’s water supply and contributing to the illnesses of a number of families. With Ed’s help, Erin files a law suit on behalf of the families involved. Based on a true story.

results.title: Boyz'n the hood
results.creator_credit: John Singleton, Steve Nicolaides and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: In the 1980s, spurned on by the success of Spike Lee, young Afro-American directors began to develop scripts and films for the mainstream American movie industry. Previously, black filmmakers in the United States had to work completely outside the system or in the exploitation genres if they wished to work with black actors and black themes. John Singleton’s “Boyz ‘n the Hood” was one of the pioneering works of this new Hollywood cinema. Cuba Gooding Jr. plays a young man who has grown up in the severely economically deprived inner-city ghetto of South Central Los Angeles. He has to decide whether to follow his friends into a life of gang criminality and drug use or whether to leave behind the “hood” and pursue an academic career as his embittered former activist father wants him to (Larry Fishburne). Refusing the exploitative excesses that dehumanise African-American ghetto characters in most action films, “Boyz n’ the Hood” reveals the complexity of growing up in a segregated world in which entrenched unemployment has meant that for young men, only the drug economy provides any chance for success or wealth. Cast also includes Ice Cube.

results.title: Bicentennial man
results.creator_credit: Chris Columbus, Gail Katz, Mark Radcliffe, Michael Barnathan, Neal E. Miller, Wolfgang Petersen, 1492 Pictures, Columbia Pictures, Laurence Mark Productions, Radiant Productions and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Starring Robin Williams and Sam Neill, this is a futuristic tale set in the not so distant future when every home will have an NDR-114 robot - the latest technological advancement to serve man. This is the story of one NDR-114 robot, who came off the production line with a unique fault - he doesn’t want to be a robot, and his amazing 200-year journey to become human. Based on the short story and novel “The Positronic man” by Isaac Asimov.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Columbus, Gail Katz, Mark Radcliffe, Michael Barnathan, Neal E. Miller, Wolfgang Petersen, 1492 Pictures, Columbia Pictures, Laurence Mark Productions, Radiant Productions and Touchstone Pictures

results.title: The Flesh = La Carne
results.brief_description: A darkly comic look at the underbelly of sexual relationships from the director of the infamous and shocking “La Grande Bouffe”. Paolo is a divorced father of two who struggles to earn a living as a nightclub entertainer. His mundane life is turned upside-down when he falls madly in love with the voluptuous and sexually experienced Francesca. They embark on a passionate affair in which Paolo willingly becomes Francesca’s sex-slave. Things take a darker turn when Paolo’s desire become obsessive and threatens to consume them both. Cast includes Sergio Castellitto, Francesca Dellera and Philippe Leotard. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Young Winston
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Carl Foreman, Columbia Pictures and Open Road Films
results.brief_description: This historical drama about British leader Winston Churchill, one of the 20th century’s great public figures, is based on his autobiography “My Early Life”. It chronicles his tumultuous rise to power from childhood to the age of twenty-six, when he delivered his first speech in the House of Commons covering his time as a war correspondent in India, his involvement in Kitchener’s Sudan expedition, and his capture and escape during the Boer War in South Africa. While it glosses over some of the less savory aspects of Churchill’s character, it nevertheless reveals him as a complex and very private man. The cast includes many esteemed British actors such as Robert Shaw, Ian Holm, Simon Ward, Anthony Hopkins, Edward Woodward and John Mills. Churchill’s mother was played by Anne Bancroft.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Attenborough, Carl Foreman, Columbia Pictures and Open Road Films

results.title: Crazy in Alabama
results.creator_credit: Antonio Banderas, Linda Goldstein Knowlton, Meir Teper and Green Moon Productions
results.brief_description: The events which unfold during the summer of 1965 prove to be a turning point in the life of 13-year-old Peejoe (Lucas Black). His simple existence is turned upside down by his Aunt Lucille (Melanie Griffith), who calmly confesses to the murder of her abusive husband then hops into her car and heads for Hollywood, determined to pursue her dream of becoming an actress. Peejoe and his brother are sent to stay with uncle Dove (David Morse), a funeral director in the small town where the boys first truly experience the division between the white and black communities. The tension caused by this situation erupts when Peejoe witnesses the racist Sheriff Doggett (Meat Loaf Aday) cause the death of a young black boy during a protest over racial segregation at the local pool. The theme of madness constantly surfaces in the narrative, with the more bizarre aspects of Lucille’s adventure juxtaposed against the irrationality of the segregation laws operating in the town at the time. The plot reaches a climax when these two types of madness collide, forcing the town to confront the darker side of human nature and examine the true meaning of insanity. “Crazy in Alabama” is the directorial debut of actor Antonio Banderas, most recognised for his appearances in the early films of Pedro Almodovar, and his more recent work in Hollywood.

results.title: The Electric horseman
results.creator_credit: Sydney Pollack, Ray Stark, Columbia Pictures Corporation, Universal Pictures and Wildwood Enterprises
results.brief_description: When a has-been, drunken rodeo star reduced to starring in breakfast cereal advertisments finds out the multi-million dollar racehorse he is expected to ride for a publicity stunt has been drugged, he steals it, riding it out into the Nevada desert where it can recuperate. Seeing a good story, a newswoman (Jane Fonda) follows him, staying one step ahead of a posse of pursuing police. By the time they reach a remote rendezvous high in the Utah mountains, she is in love with both the cowboy and his convictions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sydney Pollack, Ray Stark, Columbia Pictures Corporation, Universal Pictures and Wildwood Enterprises

results.title: Private Benjamin
results.creator_credit: Howard Zieff, Charles Shyer, Harvey Miller, Nancy Meyers and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Private Benjamin is a pampered upper-middle-class Judy Benjamin, widowed on her wedding night. She enlists for a three-year, all-expenses-paid sojourn in the U.S Army, or so she was informed by a persuasive recruiter while trying to decide what to do with her life. With such unrealistic expectations, the results can only be disastrously funny - and they are - in this now-classic tale of a fish-out-of-water coming of age via the rigors of basic training and European adventures that test her new independence.
